                                throws FitsException

        Returns:
        a newly created binary table HDU from the supplied data.
        Throws:

      • addColumn

        public int addColumn(Object data)
              throws FitsException
        Add a column without any associated header information.
        Specified by:
        addColumn in class TableHDU<BinaryTable>
        Parameters:
        data - The column data to be added. Data should be an Object[] where type of all of the constituents is identical. The length of data should match the other columns. Note: It is valid for data to be a 2 or higher dimensionality primitive array. In this case the column index is the first (in Java speak) index of the array. E.g., if called with int[30][20][10], the number of rows in the table should be 30 and this column will have elements which are 2-d integer arrays with TDIM = (10,20).
        Returns:
        the index of the new row
        Throws:
        FitsException - the column could not be added.

      • columnKeyStems

        protected String[] columnKeyStems()
        What are the standard column stems for a binary table?
        Specified by:
        columnKeyStems in class TableHDU<BinaryTable>
        Returns:
        the stems of the keywords that are associated with table columns. Users can supplement this with their own and call the appropriate deleteColumns fields.

      • setComplexColumn

        public boolean setComplexColumn(int index)
                         throws FitsException
        Convert a column in the table to complex. Only tables with appropriate types and dimensionalities can be converted. It is legal to call this on a column that is already complex.
        Parameters:
        index - The 0-based index of the column to be converted.
        Returns:
        Whether the column can be converted
        Throws:
        FitsException - if the header could not be adapted
